conclusion: Determine initial distance using v-t graph where cars just avoid collision.
Car A starts at 25 m/s, Car B at 15 m/s; both decelerate simultaneously.
Calculate deceleration for Car A: -5/6 m/s².
Calculate deceleration for Car B: -0.5 m/s².
Position function for Car A: s_A(t) = 25t - 5/12t².
Position function for Car B: s_B(t) = 15t - 0.25t².
Find time of closest approach by equating velocities: t = 30 seconds.
Calculate position of Car A at t = 20 seconds: 333.33 m.
Calculate position of Car B at t = 20 seconds: 200 m.
Determine initial distance at t = 0: 0 m, adjust for collision at t = 20: 133.33 m.
Final answer: Initial distance was approximately 133.33 meters.
